content.description: Ten feet right of Touch of Grey.  Start in deep groove with a dead snag.  Work up and slightly right on thin face climbing.  At about 2/3 height move left onto an hour glass feature and make tricky moves up steeper, spaced out pockets to the anchors.
content.protection: 10 bolts, sport anchors, 60 meter rope to lower.
content.location:
First bolt has a name tag.  Left of "Bad Company".  See

"Classic Rock Beta Picture"

climbs.name: Wall Flowers
climbs.fa: Mike Engle and Linda Engle June 2017

content.description: Climb beautifully featured rock where the wall transition from yellow to grey.  Climb up to ledge with the Maneater anchors and continue for another 15 feet up a shallow groove to the anchors.
content.protection: 9 bolts, sport anchors, 60 meter rope to lower.
content.location:
First bolt has a name tag.  Starts between Maneater and Rock Me.  See

"Classic Rock Beta Picture"

content.description: Furthest left route on the wall.  Climb up a featured deep cleft.  Ends on a ledge below an obvious bulge.
content.protection: 6 bolts, sport anchors.  60 meter rope for lowering.

climbs.name: Sweet Emotion
climbs.fa: Mike Engle and Linda Engle June 2017

content.description: Starting just uphill from a large burnt dead tree, work up featured rock staying right of a deep groove. Climb steeper rock on pockets and pinches.  At the final headwall follow well spaced but good holds to the anchor.
content.protection: 10 bolts, sport anchors, 60 meter rope to lower.
content.location:
First bolt has a name tag.  Start behind and uphill of the first large, burnt dead tree 8 feet left of Revolution.  See

"Classic Rock Beta Picture"

climbs.name: Sticky Fingers
climbs.fa: Mike Engle and Linda Engle June 2017

content.description: From the right side of the platform behind first large, burnt dead tree work up feature rock staying left of a long deep groove.  Work up excellent with thought provoking climbing to a steep headwall.  Follow good holds to the anchors just above a crescent shaped overlap.
content.protection: 9 bolts, sport anchors, 60 meter rope to lower.
content.location:
First bolt has a name tag. Two routes start from the platform behind the first large, burnt dead tree. Sticky Fingers starts on the right side of the platform.  See

"Classic Rock Beta Picture"

climbs.name: Revolution
climbs.fa: Mike Engle and Chris Barnes June 2017

content.description: Start on left (uphill) side of a nice platform behind a large, burnt dead tree. Work up fun and very featured rock to the final headwall.  Delicate liebacking leads to the anchors.
content.protection: 11 botls, sport anchors, 50 meter rope to lower.
content.location:
The first bolt has a name tag.  Two routes start from the platform behind the first large, burnt dead tree.  Revolution starts on the left side of the platform.  See

"Classic Rock Beta Picture"

content.description: Start right of deep groove that goes more than half way up the crag.  Follow fun and featured rock staying just to the right of the deep groove.  A final thin slab move leads to the anchors above a ledge below the headwall.
content.protection: 6 bolts, sport anchors, 60 meter rope to lower.
content.location:
First bolt has a name tag. Start right of the deep groove and left of Wall Flowers.  See

"Classic Rock Beta Picture"

climbs.name: Johnny B. Goode
climbs.fa: Bolted by Vernon Phinney and Chris Barnes

content.description: Climbs the north rib of the Classic Rock Fin.  Mountaineering flavor with sections of good rock punctuate by vegetation and fractured rock.  Steeper with big holds towards the finish.
content.location: Right most route on Classic Rock.

climbs.name: Gimme Shelter
climbs.fa: Parker Webb, Kira Engle, & Linda Engle July 2017

content.description: Work up a featured slab to a narrow pillar between two bushes. Continue up on well spaced pockets and  features to the final headwall.  Thin technical moves gain the anchors.
content.protection: 9 bolts, sport anchors, 60 meter rope to lower.
content.location:
First bolt has a name tag.  Starts 10 feet left of Sweet Emotion.  See

"Classic Rock Beta Picture"

climbs.name: Free Falling
climbs.fa: Chris Barnes and Supe Vitali June 2017

content.description: Start in the approach gully and work up yellow rock past a couple bolts to a patch of pockets.  Pull over the pockets to some pinches on a horizontal rail and move right to the arete.  Follow the arete and easier climbing to the anchors.
content.protection: 7 bolts, sport anchors, 60 meter rope to lower.
content.location:
First bolt has a name tag.  This is the first route encountered on the far right side of Classic Rock.  See

"Classic Rock Beta Picture"

climbs.name: Bad Company
climbs.fa: Kira Engle, Parker Webb, & Linda Engle July 2017

content.description: Work up a featured slab left of a bush to gain right leaning seams. Work a couple jams, liebacks and gastons up a thin face. Continue up the headwall until the pockets run out at the anchors.
content.protection: 8 bolts, sport anchors, 60 meter rope to lower.
content.location:
First bolt has a name tag. Left of "Gimme Shelter" starting just uphill from large burnt dead tree.  See

"Classic Rock Beta Picture"

climbs.name: Rock Me
climbs.fa: Mike Engle, Chris Barnes, and Supe Vitali June 2017

content.description: Work up a zig-zag groove to a very thin section.  May be harder if you don't use the bush. Continue up to a stance and move up a thin crack to left side of a large overlap.  Big moves lead to the anchors.
content.protection: 8 bolts, sport anchors, 60 meter rope to lower.
content.location:
First bolt has a name tag.  Route lies between Wall Flowers and Free Falling.  See

"Classic Rock Beta Picture"
